etymologies: Old English (denoting religious devotion or a form of liturgy), from Old French servise or Latin servitium ‘slavery’, from servus ‘slave’. The early sense of the verb (mid 19th century) was ‘be of service to, provide with a service’

definitions: the action of helping or doing work for someone

examples.text: millions are involved in voluntary service

shortDefinitions: action of helping or doing work for someone

definitions: an act of assistance

examples.text: he has done us a great service
he volunteered his services as a driver

shortDefinitions: act of assistance

definitions: assistance or advice given to customers during and after the sale of goods

examples.text: they aim to provide better quality of service

shortDefinitions: assistance or advice given to customers during and after sale of goods

definitions: the action or process of serving food and drinks to customers

examples.text: they complained of poor bar service

shortDefinitions: action of serving food and drinks to customers

examples.text: service is included in the final bill

definitions: a period of employment with a company or organization

examples.text: he retired after 40 years' service

shortDefinitions: period of employment with company or organization

definitions: the use that can be made of a machine

examples.text: the computer should provide good service for years

shortDefinitions: use which can be made of machine

definitions: employment as a servant

examples.text: the pitifully low wages gained from domestic service

shortDefinitions: employment as servant

definitions: a system supplying a public need such as transport, communications, or utilities such as electricity and water

examples.text: a regular bus service

shortDefinitions: system supplying public need such as transport

definitions: a public department or organization run by the government

examples.text: the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service

shortDefinitions: public department or organization run by state

definitions: the armed forces

examples.text: service personnel
troops from all branches of the services

shortDefinitions: armed forces

definitions: an area with parking beside a major road supplying gasoline, refreshments, and other amenities to motorists.
shortDefinitions: area with parking beside major road supplying petrol

definitions: a ceremony of religious worship according to a prescribed form; the prescribed form for such a ceremony

examples.text: a funeral service

shortDefinitions: ceremony of religious worship according to prescribed form

definitions: a periodic routine inspection and maintenance of a vehicle or other machine

examples.text: he took his car in for service
they phoned for service on their air conditioning

shortDefinitions: periodic routine inspection and maintenance of vehicle

definitions: a set of matching dishes and utensils used for serving a particular meal

examples.text: a dinner service

shortDefinitions: set of matching crockery used for serving particular meal

definitions: (in tennis and other racket sports) the action or right of serving to begin play.
shortDefinitions: (in tennis and other racket sports) action or right of serving to begin play

definitions: a serve.
shortDefinitions: serve

definitions: the formal delivery of a document such as a writ or summons.
shortDefinitions: formal delivery of document

definitions: perform routine maintenance or repair work on (a vehicle or machine)

examples.text: have your car serviced regularly

shortDefinitions: perform routine maintenance or repair work on

definitions: supply and maintain systems for public utilities and transportation and communications in (an area)

examples.text: the town is small but well serviced

shortDefinitions: supply and maintain systems for public utilities and transport and communications in

definitions: perform a service or services for (someone)

examples.text: the state's biggest health maintenance organization servicing the poor

shortDefinitions: perform service or services for

definitions: pay interest on (a debt)

examples.text: taxpayers are paying $250 million just to service that debt

shortDefinitions: pay interest on

definitions: (of a male animal) mate with (a female animal)

examples.text: one dog could presumably service several bitches in a day

shortDefinitions: (of male animal) mate with

definitions: have sex with or give sexual gratification to (someone).
shortDefinitions: have sex with
